definition: to see everything clearly
cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]
short name for Chahar Province 察哈爾|察哈尔[Cha2 ha1 er3]
to examine/to inquire/to observe/to inspect/to look into/obvious/clearly evident
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]
to cut/to slice/tangent (math)

sentences.english: Get some rest. It would recharge your energy levels and ensure you put things in perspective.
sentences.chinese: 休息會讓你重新精力充沛，並且確保你洞察一切。

sentences.english: The great God, opened the eyes of your insight into all.
sentences.chinese: 偉大的神，睜開你的眼睛洞察一切。

sentences.english: Only souls can understand everything, we can not see the nature of things.
sentences.chinese: 只有心靈能洞察一切，本質的東西是肉眼看不到的。

sentences.english: It is only with heart that one can see rightly, what is essential is invisible to the eyes.
sentences.chinese: 只有心靈能洞察一切，本質的東西是肉眼看不到的。

sentences.english: It is said that love is blind but friendship is clairvoyant .
sentences.chinese: 有人說過，愛情是盲目的，但友誼，能洞察一切。

sentences.english: His sharp eyes can observe everything.
sentences.chinese: 他犀利的雙眼能夠洞察一切。

definition: clear as a flame (idiom); to see things absolutely clearly
to understand thoroughly/to see beyond the facade/to see through (sb)
to clearly understand
see through (a person, scheme, trick etc)
to see through something at first glance (idiom)
wise and farsighted
lit. seeing clearly the downy feathers of autumn (idiom, from Mencius)/fig. perceptive of even the finest detail
to see clearly
predictable/sth one can predict without being a clairvoyant
to see through/disillusioned with/to reject (the world of mortals)
insight
to remain calm in the face of events (idiom)
omniscient
omniscient and omnipotent
see 看破[kan4 po4]
keen/sharp/acute
